physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Eleven patients presented with abdominal pain, nausea, and/or emesis. Eight patients had prior acute weight loss.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tachypnea and dyspnea became more prominent as the lactic acidosis syndrome progressed to multiple-organ failure within days of hospitalization in nonsurvivors.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Median venous plasma lactate levels were 12/H115065.3 mmol/L at presentation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Concurrent chemical pancreatitis was identified in 6 patients. Histopathologic studies confirmed hepatic macrovesicular and microvesicular steatosis in 6 patients.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Five patients died with rapid progression to otherwise unexplained multiple-organ failure; two presented with high venous plasma lactate levels and died within 24 h.
